title: matt hancock broke law over
story: Matt Hancock broke law over Tory peer Dido Hardings appointment during pandemicThe High Court found former Health Secretary Matt Hancock failed to comply with equalities duties when he appointed Baroness Harding and ex-Sainsburys boss Mike Coupe to top jobsFormer Health Secretary Matt Hancock Image: Crown ByLizzy BuchanDeputy Online Political EditorBrian Farmer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments Ex-Health Secretary Matt Hancock broke equality law by handing Tory peer Dido Harding a top health job, the High Court has found.Two judges ruled that Mr Hancock did not comply with a public sector equality duty in relation to appointments of Conservative peer Baroness Dido Harding and Mike Coupe to posts in . Race equality thinktank the Runnymede Trust was granted the declaration by Lord Justice Singh and Mr Justice Swt after a High Court hearing in December. The Good Law Project joined the Runnymede Trust in the action. The judges ruled that the Runnymede Trust had sufficient standing to bring a public sector equality duty challenge but GLP did not.The ruling centred on Mr Hancockaposs decision to appoint Baroness Harding as interim executive chair of the National Institute for Health Protection in August  and ex-Sainsburyaposs boss Mr Coupe as director of testing for NHS Test and Trace in September . Lawyers representing the two organisations suggested that people outside the tight circle in which senior Conservative politicians and their friends moved were not being given opportunities. They said an unfair policy was being challenged. Ministers disputed the claims made against them. Jason Coppel QC, who led the two organisationsapos legal teams, told Lord Justice Singh and Mr Justice Swt that the challenge was based on equality legislation and public law. He said the Government had a policy or practice of making appointments to posts critical to the pandemic response without adopting any, or any sufficient, fair or open competitive processes. Mr Coppel said people less likely to be known or connected to decision-makers were put at a disadvantage. He also said the Government was failing to offer remuneration for high-level full-time roles and excluding all candidates who were not already wealthy or held other posts for which they would continue to be paid.  Lord Justice Singh and Mr Justice Swt said in a written ruling: It is the process leading up to the two decisions which has been found by this court to be in breach of the public sector equality duty. For those reasons we will grant a declaration to the Runnymede Trust that the Secretary of State for Health and Social Care did not comply with the public sector equality duty in relation to the decisions how to appoint Baroness Harding as interim executive chair of the NIHP in August  and Mr Coupe as director of testing for NHSTT in September . Dr Halima Begum, Chief Executive of the Runnymede Trust, welcomed the findings. She said: ‚ÄúThe judgement handed down today by the High Court is incredibly signicant to the British people. It shows the importance of the Public Sector Equality Duty and its role in protecting the people of this nation from the closed shop of Government appointments, not least in a time of national crisis where people from our minority communities were dying from Covid in hugely disproportionate numbers. Mr Hancock‚Äôs spokesman said the judgement aposthe claim brought by Good Law Project fails in its entiretyapos, therefore highlighting the fact this group continues to waste the courtaposs time. He said the High Court ruling ‚Äústates that aposthe evidence provides no support ... at allapos for the allegation that Dido Harding secured senior positions on the basis of apospersonal or political connectionsapos in the Government‚Äù. He said: They accept these aposwere urgent recruitment processes which needed to find highly specialised, experienced and available candidates within a short space of time. Letaposs not forget, we were dealing with an unprecedented global pandemic where time was of the essence in order to protect and save lives. Mr Hancock resigned as Health Secretary last year after admitting to breaching his own Covid guidelines by kissing an aide in his office. news politics russian-invasion-would-not-stop-"Liz Truss: ‚ÄòWe could be on the brink of a war in Europe‚ÄôByLizzy BuchanDeputy Online Political Editor:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments A Russian invasion would not stop at Ukraine and could lead to conflicts in other countries, Liz Truss has warned.The Foreign Secretary urged Russian President Vladimir Putin to pull back from the brink as she issued a grim warning that military action could be imminent. Boris Johnson will chair an emergency COBR meeting today after he cut short a UK tour to deal with the Ukraine crisis. The Prime Minister spoke to US President Joe Biden on Monday night, when both leaders agreed there was a crucial window for diplomacy but the threat of Russian aggression remained serious.More than , Russian troops are massed on the Ukrainian borders. But some units started toto their bases on Tuesday morning, offering a glimmer of hope for a diplomatic solution.  Ms Truss said Europe was teetering on the brink of war and time was running out to find a diplomatic solution. And she said the crisis could embolden other countries with military ambitions. The senior Tory told Sky News: If we saw an invasion into Ukraine, there would be severe costs in terms of a long-running conflict, we could see the undermining of security more broadly in Europe and could see other aggressors around the world see it as an opportunity to expand their ambitions too. This is a very dangerous moment for the world. Ms Truss said the stability of Europe was hanging in the balance. The big risk, of course, isthere is an invasion into Ukraine that will be hugely damaging for Russia and Ukraine. And it will further undermine the stability of Europe, she said. This, I fear, would not stop at Ukraine. This is an attack on the neighbouring states of Russia and other east European countries in trying to undermine legitimacy of them being part of NATO.  She said she was very worried about the situation, adding: We could be on the brink of a war in Europe, which would have severe consequences not just for the people of Russia and Ukraine, but also for the broader security of Europe. There is still time for Vladimir Putin to step away from the brink. But there is only a limited amount of time for him to do that. Mr Putin and his foreign minister Sergei Lavrov have agreed to continue down the path of negotiations, prompting hopes that there could still be a way to avert war. A Downing Street source said there was some hope that diplomacy could work and Russia could step back. The UK and its Western allies have warned that any Russian incursion into Ukraine would be met with an unprecedented package of sanctions Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON NatoLiz TrussVladimir PutinUkraine crisis" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get UK politics insight with our free daily email briefing straight to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: blind dog searching home after
story: Blind dog searching for home after almost starving to death on the streetsDoru has been described as an amazingly trusting and affectionate dog despite everything he has been through - and would make a great family pet to the right ownerDoru is searching for a permanent home Image: Blind Dog Rescue UKByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Feb |commentsHe has nothing but love to give - but has been unable to secure a home due to his disability.Doru, who is between three and four years old, is completely blind - and keeps being cast aside by potential owners who donapost want a disabled dog.Little Doru was picked up as a stray and is currently living with foster carers in Lancashire - but is desperate to secure a permanent home.Currently underweight at just .kg, the medium-sized dog is slowly gaining back fatty tissue and lost muscle.A spokesperson at Blind Dog Rescue UK, who have launched a rehoming appeal, said: ‚ÄúDoru is a very good and friendly boy. He is good with other dogs and people. He hasnapost been cat tested.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.‚ÄúDoru would love a home with a garden and can live with another dog for company.‚Äù He has been described as an ‚Äúamazingly trusting and affectionate‚Äù, who has lots of energy and loves his walks. However, he can get nervous when walking in unfamiliar settings and would need to stay close to his owner on a lead. Doru‚Äôs foster family said: ‚ÄúHe is not bothered by house noises and ignores cats, squirrels and ducks in the park. ‚ÄúHe is quite quiet. He is very quick to learn and now sits and waits on command and has stopped snatching treats. He is gentle and playful with other dogs. ‚ÄúDoru has been known to jump on tables and kitchen surfaces still and is very ‚Äòhungry‚Äô.  ‚ÄúHe is clean in the house mostly but still needs monitoring. He can be restless in the evening. ‚ÄúAll in all, he‚Äôs an absolute poppet. A dear little dog.‚Äù Blind Dog Rescue UK works to rehome blind and partially sighted dogs who have been subjected to the ‚Äúworst of humanity yet still have an astonishing capacity to adapt, love and become perfect ambassadors for blind dogs everywhere‚Äù. Many of the dogs in their care have been victims of abuse, neglect, disease or trauma - and struggle to survive in shelters. A Blind Dog Rescue UK statement reads: ‚ÄúIt is incredibly dficult for sighted dogs to survive anyof time in these shelters let alone blind or partially sighted dogs. ‚ÄúWe need to get to these dogs quickly and secure their immediate release and treatment. ‚ÄúThese dogs may have been deliberately blinded, involved in road traffic accidents or long term sufferers of painful conditions such as glaucoma. ‚ÄúThey need veterinary care and to be given the safety and comfort of a foster home in which to start healing. ‚ÄúHere they are given love and affection and a warm bed - possibly the first they will have experienced in their letimes. At this point we are able to start assessing and promoting these wonderful dogs for forever homes.To adopt Doru, or find out more information about him, contact Blind Dog Rescue UK via their website www.bdruk.org.Do you have a story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsDogsRescueAnimalsValentines DayLove" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: brexit eu rules changes imports
story: Are you ready to import from the EU into the UK  Pasta firm has genius idea to helpAny business importing from the European Union into the UK must now be able to prove their meet the new rules of origin requirementsAdvertorialByDave MastersDigital Commercial Editor:,  Feb Rules of origin are an important trading requirement. If you sell goods to the EU, or buy goods from the EU and bring them into the UK, you need to be able to prove that they meet the new rules of origin requirements to access preferential tarfs. It‚Äôs vital you understand the new rules to keep your business moving. To benefit from the preferential tarfs, you must have proof that any goods you import from the EU originate there, or any goods you export to the EU originate in the UK. Proof of origin can either be a statement of origin completed by the exporter, or evidence of the importer‚Äôs knowledge of where products originate. If you cannot prove the origin, you or your EU customer may be liable to pay the full rate of customs duty and could face penalties. Andrew Macleod, founder of London-based restaurant brand Emilia‚Äôs Crafted Pasta, explains that imports from the EU are vital to his brand: ‚ÄúWe import ingredients directly from Italy, including special cured meats, cheeses, drinks and alcohol. Each of our suppliers is hand-picked.‚Äù  Has he had to make any changes to his business now that there are new import rules in place  ‚ÄúYes ‚Äì of course we already knew the origin of all the goods we import as we source everything carefully. But we‚Äôve trained two of our managers on the rules around importing, so we know that we have staff in house who are well versed in the process.‚Äù  And having successfully navigated the changes, what advice would Andrew offer other businesses that import  ‚ÄúWe found using a customs agent really helps the process run smoothly, but it‚Äôs equally important that you understand the rules yourself,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not too late, and the gov.uk site has lots of valuable information.‚Äù  You must be able to prove the origin of any product you import You can choose to work with a freight forwarder or courier To benefit from preferential tarfs, you must be able to prove that any goods you import originated in the EU Note:you‚Äôre moving goods between Great Britain and Northern Ireland, rules of origin work dferently. Contact the Trader Support Service for up-to-date guidance and support. FIND OUT WHAT YOU NEED TO DO. Visit gov.uk rules-of-origin

title: crazy chicken lady whose noisy
story: Crazy chicken lady whose noisy cockerels wake neighbours at am taken to courtJess Marson, a -year-old HGV driver, said she can‚Äôt imagine le without her cockerels or her clan of geese, goats and a pot-bellied pedigree pig called BrianJess Marson, who describes herself as the crazy chicken lady Image: YorkshireLive MENByRobert Sutclfe:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb  A woman who describes herself as the ‚Äúcrazy chicken lady‚Äù is being taken to court after locals were repeatedly woken at am by the noise her cockerels make.Jess Marson, a -year-old HGV driver, said she can‚Äôt imagine le without her cockerels and the rest of her animals, which include geese, goats and a pot-bellied pedigree pig called Brian.But according to Yorkshire Live reports, her neighbours in the semi-rural area of Clayton West, Yorkshire, claim they have been plagued by the noise for three years, with crowing at am as well as late into the night.A neighbour first complained to the local Kirklees Council in , when the complaint was investigated and Ms Marson served with a noise abatement order. But because of her failure to abide by it, she now faces a day at Kirklees Magistratesapos Court next month. A witness statement from one resident says: The noise from the crowing cockerels has affected and continues to affect our daily le.  This is not just a single bird crowing occasionally, they said. Typically, once one starts other birds join in with almost continual crowing either simultaneously or consecutively.Depending on the season and weather we have had our sleep disturbed often as early as am or earlier, every day of the week including weekends.In addition, frequently the crowing would continue into the late evening. With such disturbance to our health has been affected as well as disturbing and spoiling any enjoyment we might have in being outside in our garden. More so in summer when doors and windows are typically open the noise also infiltrates the house. Almost three years ago, early , we started to be woken up in the early morning by the sound of cockerels crowing. As this carried on we discovered the birds were housed a short distance away. The birds are in a direct line to, and almost at the same height as our bedroom window, around m away. Over time the number of birds kept has been increased exacerbating the issue. We believe that at least six cockerels have been kept and possibly  or more since . It is almost three years since the problem started and our first complaint was made to Kirklees Council in . Jess, who has a background in animal welfare, said: I love these cockerels. I donapost have children so these animals are like my aposbabiesapos. Obviously, it is not nice when you are being woken up but this is a semi-rural area and I rent the land from a local farmer. I was mad when I found out there had been a complaint. I would have liked the person concerned to have come to me personally instead of complaining via the council. I have had anti-crow collars fitted to the cockerelsapos throats which tighten their passages and dull the sound and I think that has made a dference. I have done that on all of them but it works better on some of them than others. The council wants me to put them in a dark box but I think that is cruel.She has now set up a GoFundMe page outlining her plight and asking for people to help her raise hundreds of pounds so she can be defended by a solicitor in court.In it, she pleads: I myself suffer from anxiety, of which keeping my chickens, , helps massively with this. I donapost have children, they are my world. I love each and every one of my babies! I would be heartbrokenthey were made to be removed. Please help me with my fight to keep my boys! Kirklees council have been approached for comment.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Court caseChickenAnimals" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: extra pressures shaping way gps
story: Extra pressures are shaping the way GPs care for us with more remote consultationsMiriam Stoppard says that doctors increased workloads have changed our relationship with them foreverCovid has meant doctors are busier than ever Image: Getty Images WestendopinionByMiriam Stoppard:,  Feb |commentsWith the burden of Covid, there‚Äôs no doubt it‚Äôs ¬≠become harder to get a GP appointment ‚Äì and their workload has rocketed. But a Manchester University study has shown it‚Äôs a ¬≠relatively small group of patients who have been piling on additional pressure at surgeries. These ‚Äúfrequent attenders‚Äù account for a large proportion of a GP‚Äôs ¬≠workload ‚Äì % of appointments, including ¬≠face-to-face consultations. The findings go some way to explain why it‚Äôs so hard to see a GP. Frequent attenders ‚Äì classed as people having more appointments than % of patients at their practice, have more than doubled their number of clinic visits in the last two decades. The study ran from - and looked at million consultations from .million patients in  ¬≠GP practices. It showed four out of  patients were frequent attenders. Co-author Dr Maria Panagioti, from Manchester University, said: ‚ÄúFrequent attenders also may have special health and social care needs but for a iety of reasons we do not yet fully ¬≠understand how best to meet them.‚ÄùConsultations with GPs by frequent attenders increased from an average of  in  to  in . But when consultations with other staff at GP clinics, such as nurses, were added in, the average figure more than doubled from  to . To cope with more requests for appointments GPs are using a iety of means, including non-face-to-face, such as telephone and online. It seems the traditional way of patients seeing GPs is being replaced by a new working model where other staff members are using dferent ways simply to cope with workloads. Co-author Professor Evan ¬≠Kontopantelis from Manchester University, said: ‚ÄúThis is the first study to show that frequent attenders, the top % of consulters, have largely and progressively contributed to increased workload in general ¬≠practices across the UK over the last  years.‚Äù Co-author Professor Aneez Esmail, also from Manchester University, said: ‚ÄúOur findings show frequent attenders account for an increasing proportion of face-to-face consultations with GPs and are responsible for nearly % of consultations fairly constantly over time.‚Äù Dr Panagioti added: ‚ÄúBut these ¬≠findings may also suggest the increase in multi-disciplinary staff working in general practices is perhaps the only solution for sustaining primary care. ‚ÄúIndeed, the large increase in the general practice workload over the last  years means having extended multidisciplinary teams is necessary to meet a wide range of patient needs through a range of ways such as remote consultations.‚Äù Sounds like general practice will never be the same. title: first picture schoolboy 9 crushed
story: First picture of schoolboy, , crushed to death by tree felled by Storm Malik weatherJacob Gallon, from Longton, Stoke had been a promising young boxer and a much-loved schoolboy when he was killed by a falling tree while shooting pheasants with his familyJacobs devastated parents have given the GoFundMe their blessing but said they were too upset to speak about the tragic incident Image: GofundmeByRob AndrewsRuby DaviesHollie Bone:,  Feb |comments Heart-breaking tributes have flooded in for a schoolboy who was killed by a falling tree which fell in the midst of Storm Malik. Jacob Gallon, nine, died from the injuries he sustained when he was struck down on January , as the storm battered the UK with mph winds.The Gladstone Primary Academy Pupil from Longton, Stoke, had been on a pheasant shoot in the Staffordshire Moorlands when the tragic incident unfolded. Now his friends and family have launched a GoFundMe in his memory which has been shared with the blessing of his devastated parents who remain too upset to speak at this time, StokeLive reports.Appeal organiser Sarah Thrusfield said: I am helping to raise some funds for Jacobaposs parents and siblings.  Jacob tragically lost his le after being hit by a fallen tree on January . He was out on a pheasant shoot with some family and friends doing what he loved and did almost every weekend. His passing came as a massive shock to not only his loved-ones but hundreds of family, friends, teachers and people who didn‚Äôt even know him. Letaposs try to show this beautul family a bit of love and support. RIP beautul boy, youaposll be sadly missed. Jacob and a -year-old man were both injured as the tree came down at Heath House - a -acre estate where they had been shooting pheasant. But tragically Jacob was later pronounced dead at Royal Stoke University Hospital after doctors had exhausted all efforts to save him. The youngster had also been a member of the Ten Count Boxing Club, in Bentilee, where staff said he had shown great promise.  Owner Max Maxwell said: He was a good lad - a big, strong nine-year-old. He had done some sparring sessions, he was big and strong. I couldnapost wait until he got older because at  they are allowed to have their first real go at boxing matches. I was keeping an eye on him. It looked like he had a lot of talent for his age. He was very polite. When he sparred with the younger boxers who were smaller than him, he was very patient and very gentle with them. He was a very nice lad. When we found out what had happened it was very sad. It seems surreal, we couldnapost really believe it. Everyone at the club is devastated.  I just want to send our best wishes out to his family and I hope theyaposre ok. He had been coming to the club since we opened in July. He would come two to three times a week. He had a lot of promise. I want to send our condolences to the family. Grief is very hard to deal with,they need anything from us, or want to come and use the gym, or anything like that, itaposs there for them. Our service is there for themthey want to talk or let off some steam, weaposre open to them.To support the fund-raising appeal click here.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON StormsTributesWeather" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: know infamous prince andrew photo
story: All we know about infamous Prince Andrew photo - from mystery thumb to fake claimsThe snap of Prince Andrew shows him with his arm around the waist of Virginia Giuffre, while now-convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell grins behind them has caused a stir since it emergedThe image has become infamous since the claims about Prince Andrew first surfaced Image: US District Court - Southern DisByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb The mystery surrounding the infamous photo of Prince Andrew with Virginia Giuffre may never be found out after the Duke and his accuser sensationally reached a ‚Äúsettlement in principle‚Äù in the civil sex claim filed in the US today.The snap of the Duke of York shows him with his arm around the waist of Ms Giuffre, while now-convicted sex trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell grins behind them.Ms Giuffre alleges she was forced by Jeffrey Epstein and Maxwell to have sex with the Duke on three occasions after being trafficked by the pair. Andrew has denied Ms Giuffre‚Äôs claims. Ms Giuffre included the infamous photo in her complaint against Prince Andrew, claiming she was forced to have sex with him on the night the image was taken - when she was .  The -year-old has vehemently denied all the allegations against him. This photo was set to become a key piece of evidence as speculation was mounting over its authenticity and allegations that it has been lost. The Duke today was spared the courtroom showdown following the settlement.A document submitted to a US court said: Virginia Giuffre and Prince Andrew have reached an out of court settlement. The parties will file a stipulated dismissal upon Ms Giuffreaposs receipt of the settlement . Prince Andrew intends to make a substantial donation to Ms. Giuffreaposs charity in support of victimsapos rights. A document submitted to a US court said: Virginia Giuffre and Prince Andrew have reached an out of court settlement. The parties will file a stipulated dismissal upon Ms Giuffreaposs receipt of the settlement . Prince Andrew intends to make a substantial donation to Ms. Giuffreaposs charity in support of victimsapos rights. Here is all we know about the infamous photo so far: Where is the original   Ms Giuffre has reportedly lost the original photo.A source told the Daily Beast: The picture is not in Virginia‚Äôs possession.Furthermore, it has been claimed that no one on Giuffreaposs legal team knows where it is or that they have even seen the original themselves. The insider said they didnapost knowthe original still existed. It is thought to have gone missing during Ms Giuffreaposs move from the US to Australia at some point between  and . Is the photo fake  Prince Andrew told Emily Maitlis during a Newsnight interview in : ‚ÄúFrom the investigations that we‚Äôve done, you can‚Äôt prove whether or not that photograph is faked or not because it is a photograph of a photograph of a photograph‚Ä¶Nobody can prove whether or not that photograph has been doctored, but I don‚Äôt recollect that photograph ever being taken.‚ÄùThe Dukeaposs legal team had previously requested the original photo of Prince Andrew with Ms Giuffre. It is believed the Duke of Yorkaposs lawyers will attempt to cast doubt on the photo.  It is has been reported they want the photo so its authenticity can be evaluated by experts. Melissa Lerner, Andrew‚Äôs attorney, told The Daily Beast: ‚ÄúThere are concerns about its authenticity. The legal team requested the original from Giuffre‚Äôs attorneys in November , and it was not provided to them.‚Äù Who does the mystery thumb belong to   The original uncropped photo of Prince Andrew standing beside a young Ms Giuffre shows a mystery thumb in the bottom right corner.Who took the snap has remained a mystery for  years. Ms Giuffre alleges that the photo was taken at Maxwellaposs house in Belgravia, central London, after a night out at Tramp nightclub in Mayfair . During a disastrous BBC Newsnight interview in , the Duke claimed he could not remember meeting Ms Giuffre. He insisted that an alleged encounter in  did not happen because he spent the day with his daughter, Princess Beatrice, taking her to Pizza Express in Woking, Surrey. The Mirror contacted Ms Gufreaposs and Prince Andrewaposs legal team in the US, as well as a representative of his legal team in the UK in regards to allegations of the photo being lost. news uk-news major-change-covid-testing-coming-"Covid-: Dr Amir surprised at how soon isolation will endByBenjamin LynchTrends Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsA signicant rule change in the coming weeks could impact on the pocket of Brits as they learn to deal with the coronavirus becoming endemic. The government hopes to announce that an end to all Covid restrictions, including the mandatory period required for self-isolating, will be in place by the end of February. Parliament is currently on recess, but the Prime Minister is due to announce his plan for living with Covid when MPsnext week on Monday, February . Another change, this time to testing, is also likely to be announced. Boris Johnson looks set to unveil the change that could impact Brits up to ¬£ at a time, as the UK looks to learn to live with the virus.So what is the change and why will Brits be charged  Will PCR tests be scrapped  Free PCR tests now look set to be scrapped and could cost people ¬£they want to get their hands on one. The Living Safely With Covid plan is due to be published on February  and may well include the plans to scrap free PCRs.  PCR tests have been vital to determinea person has Covid, as they are more accurate than lateral flow testsand have become a requirement for travel to and from certain countries around the world at ious points during the pandemic. The hope is that LFTs becoming more widely available will mean PCRs will not be so heavily relied upon. Why are free PCR tests set to be scrapped   The Treasury will be hoping to save billions by announcing the end to free tests. Covid figures have taken a downward trend recently. The seven-day average has been falling since January .  However, UK Health and Security Agencywants the government to keep providing free tests until at least the start of April and some experts are also concerned that the changes will be taken as a signal by people with Covid that they should continue to mix in public setting, despite having clear symptoms of the virus. Will I have to pay for a PCRI am vulnerable  It is believed that PCR tests will remain free for those listed as vulnerable, as well as those in hospitals and in high-risk settings. Sources toldthat this will also include the . million eligible for antiviralsthey contract Covid. The government will outline the full details in the upcoming plan, but say there are no intentions to completely scrap community testing. A spokesperson added: Everyone can continue to get free tests and we are continuing to encourage people to use rapid tests when they need them. Record numbers of tests are being delivered to pharmacies, homes and those who need them. Testing continues to play an important role in helping people live their day to day lives, keep businesses running and keep young people in school. news uk-news moment-gang--schoolkids-ambush-"Leeds: Schoolgirls harassed by large group in SeacroftByMellissa DzinziJoe Smith:,  Feb |comments A video shared on social media shows the shocking moment two schoolgirls were ambushed by a large group of students. In the video, which has been widely shared on social media, the gang of ‚Äú to ‚Äù kids and teenagers can be seen kicking and punching the girls as they lie on the ground screaming. A woman who witnessed the attack, by students from the Bishop Young Church of England Academy in Leeds, begged them to stop their assaut, shouting ‚Äúleave her alone‚Äù.The gang of youths then turned on the bystander who said she ended up with some of the kids ‚Äúon her‚Äù after she tried to intervene in the incident which took place near Arthur‚Äôs Rein Park in Leeds.The witness said the ambush involved over  students attacking the girls, who were reportedly thrown into a lake during the assault, Leeds Live reports. The witness described what she saw saying: ‚ÄúThey were attacking her and another. I shouted ‚Äòleave her alone‚Äô and ‚Äòwhat on earth are you doing ‚Äô ‚ÄúI just saw around  to  kids coming towards me but I wasn‚Äôt bothered about me, just the young girls. I ended up with some of the kids on me.‚Äù She added that it didn‚Äôt last long. It has been reported that the girls were thrown in the lake during the assault and Bishop Young Academy has now issued a statement to parents about ‚Äúpoor behaviour happening on the way to or from school.‚Äù  The letter signed off by the headteacher Rachael Cole states: ‚ÄúUnfortunately, over the past few days, there have been some of incidents of poor behaviour happening on the way to and from school, and in the evening within our community. Although these incidents involve a very small minority of our students, they have had a negative impact on the local community and the reputation of our Academy. We are working very closely with parents, the police and the local community to address these issues and ensure that our students are responsible citizens who make a positive contribution to our society. ‚ÄúPlease rest assured, that any time we receive information about the conduct of our students it is acted upon in the strictest possible terms, even when such behaviour occurs away from the academy. Should our students break the law, we actively encourage you to not only report it to us, but to also report it to the police and we will continue to work with the police to safeguard our students and our local community.‚Äù West Yorkshire Police have said they are making enquiries following the assault.They said: Police are making further enquiries following a report of an assault, which is said to have occurred in Dib Lane, Roundhay on  February. Anyone with information that will assist is asked to contact the East Leeds Neighbourhood Policing Team on , or by using the options on the West Yorkshire Police website. title: mum moves spanish mountains kids
story: Mum moves to Spanish mountains with kids to become monk after breakup from toxic exMum-of-three Kirsty Bortoft, from Scarborough, decided to make the move from Britain to a remote mountain in Spain, after years of suffering with severe anxiety and bad mental healthKirsty decided to give up material possessions for the peace and quiet of the off-grid le Image: Jam PressByKatie Dollard:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb A woman who suffered from debilitating anxiety and panic attacks from everyday le went off the grid with her kids in search of serenity, even becoming a monk in the process. Mum-of-three Kirsty Bortoft, from Scarborough, decided to make the move from Britain to a remote mountain in Spain, after years of suffering with severe anxiety and bad mental health. Kirsty was having regular panic attacks and said her mental health had been declining after a split from a ‚Äútoxic‚Äù ex. So she decided to give up material possessions for the peace and quiet of the off-grid le. In , Kirsty was trying to juggle le as a single mum with three young children, a two and three-year-old, and a six-month-old toddler. Kirsty said: It was extremely hard breaking up with my partner, along with having next to no money.I went to the doctors and they were lovely, but theyaposre trained in drugs and pharmacology ‚Äì a drug would numb it [my feelings] but I knew it wasnapost the answer. Then, after my appointment, I had this inner, small flickering of hope. In a moment akin to Eat Pray Love, the biography written by Elizabeth Gilbert,, Kirsty realised that she needed to find a new path. She was miserable in her office job and wanted to do something that would reignite her zest for le. The mum started by going on a free weekend course to become a le coach ‚Äì which, in a roundabout way, would soon see her jet off on a journey to Spain. Kirsty said: During a class, I had this awakening where I realised that my le was like one big jigsaw puzzle but there was one piece missing. Iaposd been trying to aposfixapos myself on the outside for so long, when really, that one piece is where I need to fix myself on the inside. I needed to go on a massive, soul-searching journey.  Kirsty had become interested in mediation, and while researching her next step stumbled across the Ishayas Monks. The monks, who live in Reus in the Mont-Ral mountains, are dedicated to consciousness and aposmastery of the selfapos ‚Äì the inward journey of aposletting goapos or surrender. Instead of GIlbertaposs Italy, India and Indonesia, the mum opted for a closer location ‚Äì taking her children along for the ride. She said: I felt so drawn to what they were teaching to the point where I took my two youngest out of school and drove to Spain to study the working of the mind and the mastery of the self with a load of monks! It may sound like a crazy decision but my extended family were really supportive. Plus, it was great for my oldest kids, who were eight and  at the time, as there was a little school there and loads of opportunities for adventure. It sounds crazy but I wasnapost scared whatsoever.  Kirsty and her children shared a house with another family, and everyone followed a programme each day including sunrise yoga and meditation. There were three other families from the UK and Australia, and a school and pool for the children to learn and have fun. Kirsty said: Our children would be taught by monk teachers and go on incredible nature adventures while the adults learned their teachings. The house was beautul, fairly big and open and with incredible views over the mountain to the coast. The breakfast would be pretty normal with porridge and lunch would be salads, soups, cold soups, fruit and then dinners were more hearty. It was a very clean diet, so no alcohol, no rubbish and it was almost all organic. Kirsty remained with the monks for four years, in the end studying to become one herself.  She graduated as an Ishaya Monk in  and was christened as Rudra Devi ‚Äì meaning The Goddess Who Removes Pain. Itaposs not about meditating  hours-a-day anymore, bald heads and big cloaks ‚Äì itaposs a new modern way!‚Äù she said. Itaposs about bringing something back into the community and using it in real le and that was what really excited me about it. We were on top of mountains, surrounded by people who wanted to be more, still, present, loving, kind and helpful. It was the best experience. While in Spain, Kirsty had kept her house in the UK and once a fully-fledged monk, decided to head back home to share her wisdom with stressed-out Brits. Now a mindset coach too, she helps people suffering from anxiety and mental health-related issues using the techniques she learned while living with the Ishaya Monks. Moving back to England, I was so excited to tell everybody about it and teach but then I realised that not everyone was ready to hear it,‚Äù she said. I knew I needed to share what Iaposd learned with the world and after a while I started to get more and more clients, and now I work with people all over the UK. I believe and teach that we get so busy with stuff thataposs generally external to us such as what s, bills, work stress what-nots, that we get confused, worried, and donapost sleep because of them. Le is for thriving, not surviving, itaposs one short le and we need to find that part inside of us that really helps us through. Up until lockdowns happened due to Covid, Kirsty dedicated some time every summer to go back and visit the monks in Spain. title: queens cousin head mysterious organisation
story: Queens cousin head of mysterious organisation - hes not the only royal involvedThe most powerful Freemason in England and Wales is the Queens first cousin Prince Edward, the Duke of Kent - and hes the longest-serving head after being appointed  years agoThe Queen and Prince Edward Image: UK PressByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience WriterErtan Karpazli:,  Feb |commentsThe Queen aposs cousin heads one of the most mysterious organisations in the UK, the Freemasons.Freemasons describe themselves as a secular social and charitable organisation which helps members make new friendships, develop themselves and make valuable contributions to charitable causes. However, the organisation is often the subject of conspiracy theories developed by people who believe Freemasons secretly run the country or change the world for their own benefit. It is believed that the group conceals at least some of its rituals, customs, or activities from the public, but the most powerful Freemason in England and Wales is less of a secret.According to My London, the head of the lodge, who members refer to as the ‚ÄòGrand Master‚Äô, is none other than the Queen‚Äôs first cousin Prince Edward, the Duke of Kent.Having been appointed in June , Edward has been serving the lodge for almost  years, making him the longest-serving head.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm.Click here to sign up. Edward, , is the son of the Queen‚Äôs paternal uncle, Prince George. In other words, Edward‚Äôs father was the brother of Queen Elizabeth‚Äôs father King George VI. He became the Duke of Kent when he was just six years old after his father was killed in a plane crash in . He has been carrying out royal duties since the age of  - first by walking behind the coffin of his uncle King George in , and then by paying homage to the Queen on her coronation in . He has also been involved with over  charities, including the Freemasons, where much of his charity work revolves around war remembrance, technology, and the growth of British industry.Although Edward is the head of the United Grand Lodge of England, he is not the head of all Freemasons worldwide. There are around  million Freemasons around the world ‚Äì , of them living in England and Wales. The Duke‚Äôs brother, Prince Michael of Kent, is also a Freemason and is Grand Master of the Grand Lodge of Mark Master Masons, and Provincial Grand Master of the Provincial Grand Lodge of Middlesex. Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh was also a Freemason having been introduced to Freemasonry in  at the age of  by his Father-in-Law King George VI. Throughout his  years, he was associated with some  charities, either as president, patron or as an honorary member.The Prince supported charitable organisations in the fields of scientic and technological research and development, the encouragement of sport, the welfare of young people, conservation and the environment. Dr David Staples, chief executive of the United Grand Lodge of England , said: ‚ÄúPrince Philip was well known for his charity work, having been involved with numerous organisations. He was devoted to philanthropy and therefore the best way to celebrate his le is by supporting the charities that the Prince himself supported. ‚ÄúFor us, this was an easy decision as Freemasonry‚Äôs core values are charity, integrity, respect and friendship. The Freemasons have been quietly getting on with making society and the lives of those less fortunate better for more than three centuries,‚Äù said Dr Staples.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news uk-news royals-relieved-prince-andrew-avoided-"Prince Andrew reaches out-of-court settlement with Virginia GiuffreByZoe ForseyFeatures Editor:,  Feb  The Queen and the royal family will be hugely relieved that Prince Andrew has managed to reach an out-of-court settlement in his civil sex case against Virginia Giuffre.Ms Giuffre alleges she was forced by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell to have sex with the Duke on three occasions after being trafficked by the pair - claims the Queenaposs son has always strongly denied. A statement released this afternoon confirmed they have reached an agreement away from the courtroom, and Andrew will make a substantial donation to Ms Giuffreaposs charity. Royal author Penny Junor believes his royal relatives will be extremely glad heaposs avoided a public trial in the US. She said: Going to trial, it could have been very, very nasty.  It could have been embarrassing, humiliating, and it would have been huge fodder for the tabloid press. It could have really taken the shine off the Queenaposs Platinum Jubilee year. ‚ÄúAt last, he‚Äôs expressing some regret and some empathy for those girls. She said his  Newsnight interview had been ‚Äúall about him‚Äù but that Andrew has ‚Äúgot it right now‚Äù. She added: ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs got it right now, it took him a long time to get there but I think he‚Äôs got it right.‚Äù Askedthere is a way back to public royal le for Andrew, Ms Juror said: ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs very, very unlikely.‚Äù Earlier this year the Monarch stripped her son of his royal titles and took back all  of his military affiliations, including Colonel of the Grenadier Guards. She faced mounting pressure to act with a letter signed by more than  Navy, RAF and Army veterans asking her to strip him of his military appointments.At the time, a source told The Mirror he was shell-shocked by the decision. Todayaposs statement, which was included in a letter submitted to US judge Lewis A Kaplan, who has been overseeing the civil sex claim brought by Ms Giuffre, said: ‚ÄúVirginia Giuffre and Prince Andrew have reached an out of court settlement. ‚ÄúThe parties will file a stipulated dismissal upon Ms Giuffre‚Äôs receipt of the settlement . Prince Andrew intends to make a substantial donation to Ms Giuffre‚Äôs charity in support of victims‚Äô rights. ‚ÄúPrince Andrew has never intended to malign Ms. Giuffre‚Äôs character, and he accepts that she has suffered both as an established victim of abuse and as a result of unfair public attacks. ‚ÄúIt is known that Jeffrey Epstein trafficked countless young girls over many years. ‚ÄúPrince Andrew regrets his association with Epstein, and commends the bravery of Ms. Giuffre and other survivors in standing up for themselves and others. ‚ÄúHe pledges to demonstrate his regret for his association with Epstein by supporting the fight against the evils of sex trafficking, and by supporting its victims.‚ÄùFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON The QueenPenny JunorPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: students told stay away college
story: Students told to stay away from college after red splatter seen on wall of nearby houseAECC University College students in Bournemouth were told to stay home as police investigate the mans head injury, with initial enquiries suggesting he was assaulted the night beforeRed spatter was found on a building near the university this morningByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsPolice have launched an investigation after a seriously injured man was found near a university, prompting students to be told to stay home this morning.Police were called to the scene in Boscombe, Bournemouth, outside the AECC University College, at around .am.The man, aged in his s, had sustained a head injury and was taken to hospital.Investigating police believe he was assaulted the night before and had been outside the education facility since .pm on Monday. A police cordon is still in place on the road to allow examinations by forensic officers. Witnesses reporting seeing red spatter, believed to be blood, was on the wall of a nearby property while officers put markers around a vehicle in a nearby car park which is closed to the public. Lectures were postponed at the AECC University College as a result of the incident.  Students were contacted and told to stay at home until further notice and no teaching will take place in the main building and Cavendish House until noon. Lesley Haig, vice-chancellor, said: ‚ÄúThere has been an incident, as far as we know not involving any staff or students here. ‚ÄúWe are waiting for the police to give us more information. Students still accessing the site although we have postponed our lectures, we expect to be fully open later, there‚Äôs no immediate risk to staff or students on site. Detective Inspector Stefanie Belton, of Bournemouth CID, said: ‚ÄúA full investigation is underway to establish how the man sustained his injuries. ‚ÄúFollowing initial enquiries, we believe the man was assaulted and has been outside the college since around .pm on Monday  February  with injuries.‚ÄúI am appealing to anyone who may have witnessed any suspicious activity in the area to please come forward.‚ÄúIf you have any information that may help us understand how the man became injured, please contact Dorset Police immediately.‚ÄúLocal officers will be carrying out high visibility patrols in the area and can be approached by anyone in the community with any information or concerns.‚ÄùRead MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON CrimeDorset Police" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: sustaining talks stop russia invading
story: Sustaining talks to stop Russia invading Ukraine is better than the alternativeVladimir Putin is a dangerous authoritarian nationalist and but we must hope he retains a degree of rationality and recognises that invasion would not fulfil his goals and could backfire disastrously, Voice of the Mirror says " content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _JS.jpg" width"" "" Russian president Vladimir Putin Image: ALEXEY NIKOLSKY Sputnik AFP via Getty ImagesopinionByVoice of the Mirror:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |comments US President Joe Biden and UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson conferring to build a Nato united front to deter Russia from invading Ukraine is a high-level diplomatic and military manoeuvre.By following French President Emmanuel Macron to Moscow to deliver face-to-face appeals to Vladimir Putin, the German leader Olaf Scholz is reinforcing the desire of European nations as well as the USA, and of course Ukraine, to avoid a potentially bloody conflict.Putin is a dangerous authoritarian nationalist threatening a neighbour, yet we must hope he retains a degree of rationality and recognises that invasion would not fulfil his goals and could backfire disastrously.Giving Putin a way out that respects Ukraine‚Äôs independence may be repugnant to many, but it would be far preferable to an armed conflagration at the heart of Europe. Ukraine has signalled a preparedness to sideline or abandon a desire to join Nato. Sustaining talks, however strained, is better than the alternative.  Prime Sinister The indefensible cover-up intensies as Boris Johnson arrogantly declares he will keep secret his responses to the police questionnaire on No lockdown parties. Voters deserve to know his excuses for attending boozy bashes when his Government was busy imposing draconian laws on ordinary people, punishing more than ,. If the PM claims he‚Äôs stupid, clueless, accident-prone, unfortunate or above the law, the nation has a right to see it in black and white. Johnson‚Äôs lies and reckless approach are why he is in a deep hole in the first place and why a law-abiding nation is absolutely furious. Heir-borne  Clarence House has announced that the Duchess of Cornwall now has Covid as well as her husband Prince Charles. We wish them, along with the , newly infected people also announced yesterday, a full and speedy recovery. title: uks most pointless parking reservation
story: Are these UKs most pointless parking reservation yellow lines in the UK Britons have slammed double yellow lines in Sheerness, Kent, as the "most pointless parking restrictions ever" claiming they are "an absolute eyesore and totally unnecessary"Swale Council defended the fresh paintwork which is now scheduled for removal Image: KMG   SWNSByJoe MorganLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsDouble yellow lines painted behind a bench in a car-free pedestrian zone have been branded the most pointless parking restrictions ever. Parking and cars are banned at any time in Sheerness, Kent, where the townaposs clock tower normally stands in an area impossible for traffic to access. Before it was pedestrianised, there were double yellow lines on the street that have gradually faded over time. Swale Council has defended the painting as refreshed, but has also conceded they are due to be removed anyway. Conservative Cllr Cameron Beart, who represents Queenborough and Halfway on Swale Council and Sheppey on Kent County Council, said they must be the most pointless double yellow lines ever. He added: They are an absolute eyesore and totally unnecessary in a pedestrianised part of the conservation area. They serve no purpose at all and should be removed.  Stephen Jackson, whose Jacksonwood Vintage Tea Rooms overlook that section of the High Street, was equally confused. He said: You could hardly see the old lines but thataposs not an excuse for repainting them, as they shouldnapost be there now. The old lines were probably there from before the benches were put in. Itaposs a complete waste of time. After carrying out the paint job, Swale Council confirmed the lines are now due to be removed.  A spokesperson said: The double yellow lines that were already at the clock tower were refreshed by our lining contractors who were working to repaint yellow lines in Broadway and the high street in Sheerness. We carry out regular lining and signage maintenance around Swale. These restrictions are now scheduled for removal. The clock tower is currently being renovated and is not expected tountil later this year. title: uk weather forecast exact dates
story: UK weather forecast: Exact dates of two storms to batter Britain with mph windsThe Met Office says two low pressure systems that will bring spells of very strong winds and potentially snow between Wednesday and Saturday have been named as storms Dudley and EuniceThe two low pressure systems will bear down upon the UK later this week Image: Getty ImagesByMirror:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb  It‚Äôs set to be a wet and wild end of the week for Brits, with two storms set to hit the country expected to bring mph winds and potentially some snow. Two low pressure systems were originally expected to bring spells of very strong winds and potentially snow between Wednesday and Saturday, but Brits could feel the impact of sooner than thought after forecasters moved forward the warning period.Storm Dudley, which carries a danger to le weather warning, will likely start and finish earlier than expected, according to the Met Office, ahead of Storm Eunice moving in, bringing strong winds and potentially some snow for parts of the country on Friday.Gusts of up to mph are set to batter the whole of the country due to a jet stream which was originally forecast to hit on Wednesday and Thursday under a yellow weather warning.  But this has now been upgraded to a more severe amber warning bringing le-threatening gales to parts of Northern Ireland, most of Scotland and the north of England. Met Office chief meteorologist Paul Gundersen said an active jet stream is driving low-pressure systems across the country, both of which are likely to cause some disruption.Winds are expected to be strongest on exposed coasts and hills of Scotland, with -mph possible further inland. This is applicable to southern and western Scotland, the north coast of Northern Ireland and northern England, where the strongest and most disruptive winds are expected.  Winds are expected to ease through Thursday afternoon and evening. The stormy conditions will barely have subsided before the next low pressure system, named Storm Eunice, will track across central areas of the UK. According to the Met Office, further impacts are expected from disruptive gale force winds - with - mph winds expected inland. Heavy rain is expected to come alongside the system as well and there is a potential for some signicant snowfall over hills in the Midlands and further north.National Highways Head of Road Safety Jeremy Phillips encouraged drivers to check the latest weather and travel conditions before setting off on journeys, and considertheir journey is necessary and can be delayed until conditions improve.‚ÄúIf you do intend to travel, then plan your journey and take extra care, allowing more time for your journey,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIn high winds, there‚Äôs a particular risk to lorries, caravans and motorbikes so we‚Äôd advise drivers of these vehicles to slow down. ‚ÄúDrivers of other vehicles should be aware of sudden gusts of wind which can affect handling and braking, and give high-sided vehicles, caravans, and motorbikes plenty of space. In the event of persistent high winds we may need to close bridges to traffic for a period, so please be alert for warnings of closures and follow signed ersion routes.‚Äù Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Met OfficeSnowWeatherStorms" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news uk-weather-forecast-storm-dudley-"Storm Dudley: Met Office updates amber warning for strong windsByLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb |commentsStorm Dudley is bearing down on the nation bringing le-threatening winds to the UK this week. Brits could feel the impact of Storm Dudley sooner than thought after forecasters moved forward the warning period. The storm, which carries a danger to le weather warning, will likely start and finish earlier than expected, according to the Met Office.Gusts of up to mph are set to batter the whole of the country due to a jet stream which was originally forecast to hit on Wednesday and Thursday under a yellow weather warning.  But this has now been upgraded to a more severe amber warning bringing le-threatening gales to parts of Northern Ireland, most of Scotland and the north of England. This is set to reduce to a yellow wind warning by Thursday - after which Storm Eunice will bring strong winds and potentially snow to parts of the country on Friday.  The Met Office said very strong and disruptive winds are expected for the area with the risk of fallen trees, power cuts and transport delays and cancellations. Weather experts are also warning of injuries and danger to le from large waves and beach material being thrown onto coastal roads, sea fronts and homes. Yellow wind warnings are in place for the rest of Northern Ireland and northern England, central Scotland and the Midlands on Wednesday and Thursday. Storm Dudley is set to bluster its way southward with a yellow wind warning in place for southern Scotland and the rest of the UK. A Met Office spokesperson said: There is a small chance that flying debris will result in a danger to le, with fallen trees, damage to buildings and homes, roofs blown off and power lines brought down.  There is also a small risk of injury and danger to le from large waves along the coast. Residents are urged to secure loose items outdoors, shut doors and windows, park vehicles in a garage where possible, and stay indoors during the storm as much as possible. There are no UK weather warnings in place from Saturday onwards. news uk-news virginia-giuffres-lawyer-says-event-"Prince Andrew reaches out-of-court settlement with Virginia GiuffreByJosh PayneDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Feb Updated:,  Feb Virginia Giuffreaposs lawyer said I believe this event speaks for itself after the Duke of York and his accuser reached an out-of-court settlement in the civil sex claim filed in the US. Ms Giuffre, previously Virginia Roberts, made the claim against Andrew for damages in her home country of the US, claiming she was trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein, Andrewaposs friend, to have sex with the royal when she was , a minor under US law. Andrew denies the allegations against him. In a letter submitted to the United States District Court on Tuesday, Ms Giuffreaposs lawyer David Boies wrote jointly with Andrewaposs lawyers to say that the parties had reached a settlement in principle.  When asked for comment on the settlement, Mr Boies said: I believe this event speaks for itself. Court documents show the Duke will make a substantial donation to Ms Giuffreaposs charity in support of victimsapos rights. Andrew has also pledged to demonstrate his regret for his association with Epstein by supporting the fight against the evils of sex trafficking, and by supporting its victims. An attachment to the letter announcing the settlement gave brief details of the agreement between Andrew and Ms Giuffre but indicated the sum would not be disclosed.It read: Virginia Giuffre and Prince Andrew have reached an out of court settlement. The parties will file a stipulated dismissal upon Ms Giuffreaposs receipt of the settlement . Prince Andrew intends to make a substantial donation to Ms. Giuffreaposs charity in support of victimsapos rights. Prince Andrew has never intended to malign Ms. Giuffreaposs character, and he accepts that she has suffered both as an established victim of abuse and as a result of unfair public attacks.  It is known that Jeffrey Epstein trafficked countless young girls over many years. Prince Andrew regrets his association with Epstein, and commends the bravery of Ms Giuffre and other survivors in standing up for themselves and others. He pledges to demonstrate his regret for his association with Epstein by supporting the fight against the evils of sex trafficking, and by supporting its victims. Lawyer Lisa Bloom, who represents eight victims of Jeffrey Epstein, welcomed the settlement as a victory for Virginia Giuffre.  She wrote on Twitter: My statement on behalf of the  Jeffrey Epstein victims I represent: aposWe hail Virginiaaposs victory today. She has accomplished what no one  could: getting Prince Andrew to stop his nonsense and side with sexual abuse victims. We salute Virginiaaposs stunning courage.apos In January, the dukeaposs lawyers submitted  reasons why the case against him should be dismissed, saying he demanded a trial by jury. Mr Boies, said his client and legal team were looking forward to confronting the royal about his denials. Representatives of the duke said they would not be commenting further than what was said in the documents submitted to the court. Buckingham Palace declined to comment on Tuesday.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince Andrew, Duke of YorkVirginia RobertsRoyal FamilyCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: bride red faced after showing
story: Bride red-faced after showing off wedding sign - as others point out rude flawPeople on Reddit have been left in stitches after spotting a happy couples wedding sign with an unfortunate calligraphy error, which makes it appear rather rudeCan you spot whats wrong ByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments When it comes to planning a wedding, of course, you want everything to feel perfect, right down to the finest detail. So, you can understand why one bride would want to show off her efforts after investing in a handwritten bespoke sign for her and her husbandaposs special day.However, all that excitement may have just come crashing down, after a number of naughty-minded internet users spotted a rather unfortunate error. The sign is written in beautul curled calligraphy, which unfortunately has made some of the words appear as though they say something entirely dferent.One Reddit user decided to share a photo of the sign on Redditaposs Wedding Shaming forum, alongside the caption: Be careful of your signage font... Mr Penis. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Yep, the unlucky couple, who on closer inspection appear to be called Ale and Denis, got more than they bargained for when the curly element of the letter D, unfortunately, appeared to look more like a P. The sign actually reads: Bienvenidos a la boda de Ale  Denis, which translated into English means, Welcome to the wedding of Ale  Denis, but that didnapost stop people sniggering over the unfortunate mishap. A few centimetres can make all the dference. Letaposs hope the couple was able to laugh about it, one Reddit user joked, while another added: Ale and Penis sounds like an extremely sketchy pub. I went to school with a Denis and our other friend would sneakily extend a line on the D down so it said penis before he turned in papers. He did it all the time lol, a third Reddit user reminisced. Fortunately, others pointed out that native Spanish speakers wouldnapost necessarily make the rude connection and we certainly hope that wasnapost the case on the happy coupleaposs big day.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news busy-working-mum-swears-fly-"Working mum explains her ‚Äòfly lady‚Äô cleaning methodByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Feb |comments As many working parents will tell you, trying to manage childcare, work and taking care of the home can feel like an impossible task. One mum, however, has revealed the genius method she uses for keeping on top of all her household chores in a matter of minutes - and it sounds so easy. Nicole Kerr, from the US, recently went viral on TikTok after she shared how she manages to keep on top of looking after both her children, working full-time and taking care of her home - while her husband also works three jobs. The -year-oldaposs unique method is called the aposfly ladyapos cleaning method, which she claims as helped her get on top of her household jobs and made her feel a lot more organised. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.Posting from her handle @mrsnicolekerr, Nicole explained that she sets a timer for  minutes a day and during that time she does as much decluttering or cleaning in one aposzoneapos or room as possible.The fly lady cleaning method consists of setting a timer for  minutes a day and doing as much decluttering or cleaning in one aposzoneapos or room as you can. In addition to that, the method also includes an hour of aposhome blessingapos which is time dedicated to bigger cleaning jobs, such as changing bedding, hoovering, taking the rubbish out or dusting. The principle of the fly cleaning method is that keeping on top of jobs by doing little and often will allow you to avoid creating huge messes that take hours to clean. Iaposm never overwhelmed with the cleaning anymore, which is saying something coming from someone who has two children three years of age and under, the mum explained in a clip. She recommends downloading the fly lady cleaning app which includes a timer and helps you ide up your time effectively.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news creepy-footage-shows-ghost-knocking-"Ghost knocks over pint in -year-old haunted pubByShabir NoorzaiKatie L Wilson:,  Feb |comments A ghost is believed to have knocked a pint off a table in a -year-old haunted pub.Pub manager Natasha Magnan confronted drinkers after beer entered up on the floor. One said that the full glass of Coors just fell off the table and it left him with goosebumps. Shocked Natasha, , was then left stunned when she watched it back on CCTV at the -year-old White Swan Inn, in Dunstable, Bedfordshire. The pint appears to suddenly plummet onto the ground despite no one being near it. It is feared the pub has been targeted by ghouls before. But Natasha thinks a former regular Chris Harris, , may have come back to haunt them this time and is behind the moving beer to play tricks on them.  Natasha said: There was quite a large group of people and I said aposYou are making quite a mess, whataposs all this beer on the floor apos And one of the boys said that wasnapost me. I was like aposYeah alright then not believing themapos and they were like aposI promise you that it just fell now, look at my goose pimples.apos One of the staff persuaded Natasha to check the CCTV footage to seethe lads were telling the truth. The security camera footage, filmed on February , shows a full pint glass sitting on a table as nearby customers sat chatting in their seats. Suddenly the glass topples off the table, despite none of the punters touching it.  Natasha recorded the CCTV footage and can be heard pointing out the blurry hand of a spirit around the pint and the candle fluttering uncontrollably on the table. She said: Looks like a hand pushed the pint off, the pint goes a bit fuzzy. One of our regulars recently died so we thought it might actually be him. She has been working at the pub for the past  years and says there have been several unusual sightings by staff and customers. She added: I have been working for  years and really havenapost seen things like this, I have heard things. All of the staff have heard things about the things going on in the pub for so many years.  I felt things like there were people walking past me when there was nobody there. Last Sunday, I moved out of the way of a dog but there was no dog in the pub on that day. One time when I closed the pub I made sure to lock all the windows shut but when I left I noticed that something had opened one of the top windows without anyone  being in the pub. Staff have felt like somebody has been watching them. The cleaner saw somebody near the toilet door but seconds later there was nobody there. The activities of the spirit in the pub have increased in the past two weeks, according to Natasha, and she believes it could be due to a clairvoyant evening due to be held at the pub. She said: It has been creepy for the last two weeks, normally nothing has been bothering us but we have a clairvoyant evening coming up. So I am just wonderingthey are coming out because of that. The pub used to be a police station before it was converted - and during its time as a police station housed hardcore prisoners inside. The cellar, which is like a curved road, contains the concrete beds where the prisoners used to sleep in the police station. Ms Magnan posted the CCTV footage of the pint being pushed on the pubaposs social media page. One viewer wrote: Always been a spooky pub. title: i accidentally fed 88 year
story: ‚ÄòI accidentally fed my -year-old grandma dog food with a side of rice‚Äô¬†The woman had sealed up a bag of raw dog food to leave in her aunties freezer and didnt think any more of it until her grandma used it to cook a meal for twoThe -year-old thought she was eating minced meat Image: Getty Images Image SourceByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Feb |commentsA woman has confessed to inadvertently feeding her grandma dog food after she mistook it for minced meat.Admitting her truth on Reddit, the woman explained how her sister had been storing raw dog food in their auntie‚Äôs freezer after spending the day at their house. She told her auntie to use it up on her own dog to save her the trouble of having to cart it back to her own house.But, months later, the raw dog food was still sealed up in a bag in the freezer. That was until her -year-old grandma decided to cook a meal for two, using what she thought was frozen minced meat.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.  The woman said: ‚ÄúMy granny decided to cook and thought my auntie put that food there - and she used it up since it had been in there for some time. ‚ÄúShe sliced up some ginger, garlic and all the usual Chinese sauces, served it with rice and some bok choy.‚Äù It wasn‚Äôt until the sisters paid their next visit when they realised what had happened. ‚ÄúWhen we went to visit, my auntie told my sister they ate the meat she left there because they thought it would go bad - and that it tasted kind of bland,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúAfter some confusion, my sister remembered and that was the day my granny and auntie ate dog food.‚Äù It is unknown whether the pair admitted the truth to their grandma and auntie - or whether it has become a family secret. However, they have been reassured by other users who have confessed to similar things happening within their own households. One user admitted: ‚ÄúI ate puppy treats and role played as a dog when I was a kid.‚Äù While another user said: ‚ÄúMy grandfather-in-law actually ate dog snacks. We found him in the kitchen eating some and we told him what it was and he thought they were good anyway. I canapost imagine, I figured theyaposd be too salty.‚ÄùDo you have any unusual dog stories to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeamDogsDogsAnimalsFunny ha ha viral" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man buys sainsburys pizza unimpressed
story: Man buys Sainsburys pizza but is unimpressed after removing cleverly-placed stickerTom Scott, a product designer, thinks staff at Sainsburys may have used the large sticker on the front of the oven pizza to hide the distinct lack of toppingsTom Scott was disappointed by his Sainsburys pizza Image: Adam Gerrard   Daily MirrorByJohn BettAudience WriterLeigh Mcmanus:,  Feb |comments A hungry man was left disappointed after buying an oven pizza from a Sainsburyaposs store as it had almost nothing on it - just a few strands of grated cheese.Tom Scott, a product designer, bought the pizza for p and he couldnapost see the lack of toppings as a huge sticker covered the face of the item.What he got was just bread and tomato sauce, with a few bits of grated cheese, and now he believes that Sainsburyaposs may have put that sticker on intentionally to hide the lack of toppings. As the Daily Star reports, heaposs taken to social media to complain and shared a snap of the sad-looking pizza, so hopefully, heaposll get his p back.What do you think of the cheese and tomato pizza  Let us know in the comments... Taking to Twitter, , he wrote alongside a laughing emoji: Hey ‚Å¶@sainsburys‚Å© any less cheese and this might be tomato bread, good to see excellent sticker placement.A customer representative called Caitlin was on hand to try and help, apologising for the lack of cheese. ‚ÄúHey Tom! Iaposm very sorry there was a lack of cheese. Can you please DM us from the link below with the name of the store they were purchased from, your full name, address and Nectar card number  So that I can look into this, Caitlin,‚Äù she wrote. The pizza Tom bought is only  pence, but you still expect to get the main ingredients even for that lowly price. We are happy to replace this itemit is not satisfactory, Sainsburyaposs say on their website. A spokesperson for Sainsbury‚Äôs added: We‚Äôre in touch with Tom to apologise for his experience and to provide a refund. This item does not meet our usual high standards and we‚Äôre investigating.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere.This comes after a man was left surprised after buying a Tesco sandwich as it was lacking one vital ingredient - so he took to social media to complain.Colin McKenzie, a taxi driver, went to his local supermarket and picked up his favourite lunch - a smoked ham and cheddar sandwich. But when he sat down to eat it he was shocked, as his sandwich contained just bread, butter, and ham - lacking the advertised cheese.He shared his discovery on Twitter and was soon inundated with comments, and one said: You need to pay extra for the cheddar.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON SainsburysFoodPizza" data-immediate"data-immediate"Serve the food you really want to eat by signing up for our tips and recipes and never be bored by your cooking againSign UpInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man discovers use extra hole
story: Man discovers use for extra hole in kitchen sink that makes washing up a breezeA man has uncovered an unusual use for the mysterious extra hole on your kitchen sink thats covered by a cap - and his discovery has blown peoples minds onlineThe cap at the front of your sink has a hidden useImage: Getty ImagesByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Feb |commentsHave you ever looked at your kitchen sink and noticed thereaposs a cap fitted to the basin on the opposite side to your taps  Not every sink has one, butyours does, youaposve probably wondered what itaposs there for.Technically, the real reason itaposs there is to cover up a hole that lets you choose which side of the basin your taps are fitted - but thataposs not nearly as exciting as the secret second use for the hole that one man on TikTok has discovered. Posting on his account, @rightguysreview, the man revealed that you can actually buy a special soap dispenser online that screws into the hole and allows you to squirt washing up liquid directly into the basin, saving you the hassle of getting the bottle out of the cupboard every time you want to wash up, or just leaving the bottle on display. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. In the clip, the man said: I was staring at my sink the other day, and I was thinking to myself, aposWhat is this other hole with a cap on for apos. So I undid it, and it came loose, and it revealed another hole. I thought maybe you could put another tap in thereyou wanted it the other way around, but in fact, I Googled it and I found out you can buy this gadget - itaposs called a soap dispenser.Really easy to fit, I bought it on eBay and it costs about ¬£.. Itaposs a great invention. The manaposs video has been viewed over , times - and commenters canapost believe they had gone so many years without knowing about their sinkaposs secret use. One person said: Well, you learn something new every day. Brilliant! While another added: Wow, Iaposm  yet didnapost know that! You learn something every day. Thank you. And a third wrote: Thataposs actually pretty genius. Fair enough! But other commenters were quick to note theyaposd been using a soap dispenser in their sink for years, with many of them insisting the hack is a game-changer. Someone said: It‚Äôs great, I‚Äôve had one three years. Never need to unscrew it, just refill from the top. As someone  added: Iaposve had one almost a year now!
